abstract: NewYork-Presbyterian moves beyond the pilot project stage on consumer-controlled health records this week, a move that will be closely watched by other institutions.
snippet: NewYork-Presbyterian moves beyond the pilot project stage on consumer-controlled health records this week, a move that will be closely watched by other institutions.
lead_paragraph: Online personal health records  controlled by patients themselves, not by hospitals, doctors, insurers or employers  have been available for years. Yet only a small percentage of Americans have digital personal health records today, analysts estimate.

headline.main: A Hospital Is Offering Digital Records
headline.print_headline: A Hospital Is Offering Digital Records
